chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)
Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jasmine M. Lariviere was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jasmine M. Lariviere is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jasmine M. Lariviere was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Jasmine M. Lariviere was found guilty of Operate w/o Valid License (1st Violation). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
03:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jasmine M. Lariviere in court. Attorney Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared by video for Jasmine M. Lariviere. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Pfeifer states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Apollo willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 03:09 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
